instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor reading -124c but all components are fine
threads.message:
Got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spins fast after about 5 seconds of being on so I ran ASD which said TN1D is reading -124c looked around <CHIP>U5535</CHIP> area no corrosion measured all components in the area everything was measuring ok.
This machine also does not boot if the charger is not connected but once running it will run fine if you unplug the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor reading -124c but all components are fine
threads.message: Check <RESISTOR>R5235</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R5236</RESISTOR>, should be 0ohm, also check pull up resistors for this bus (<RESISTOR>R5260</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R5261</RESISTOR>).....  Other than that, bad MCP............

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor reading -124c but all components are fine
threads.message:
Checked those resistors and their traces all ok, another one for the parts pile then.

Thanks for your input
